attributes.comment:
International adoptions should be exempted from increased fees. With adoptions
generally costing over $20,000, applying a fee increase to international adoptions
will prohibit many couples from growing their families through adoption. The United
States does not have enough babies available for adoption to meet the needs of
infertile couples, so many are adopting internationally. Raising the fees for
international adoptions will further limit the options for infertile couples. Even the
adoption tax credit is not enough to offset this -- the adoption agencies simply
raised their fees so that the end result is adoptive parents paying an enormous
amount of money in order to adopt a child. Adding a baby to your family should be
every person's fundamental right to do, and yet continued fee increases are
causing couples who are not doctors or lawyers to have to give up on their dream
of becoming parents. Cut the teachers and laborers a break by exempting
adoption from this fee increase.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Vita Alligood
